page.title: 12CUSTOMS/FOLKLORE IN DUNS
page.content: ANNUALLY A RIDE TO DUNS CASTLE COMMON TO CUT A DIVOT OF LAND COMMEMORATES THE RIGHT OF THE PEOPLE TO GRAZE CATTLE ON THE COMMON. GRAZING CEASED IN 1816 BUT THE RIGHT REMAINS. IN 1370 A RIDER FROM KELSO WARNED OF THE ONCOMING ENGLISH. PEOPLE HID. THEY PREPARED RATTLES OF SKINS FILLED WITH STONES TO FRIGHTEN THE ENGLISH HORSES.SWORDSMEN ATTACKED THE ENGLISH. THE LOCAL STREAM RAN WITH BLOOD & IS STILL NAMED "THE BLOODY BURN". THE { {MOTTO}"DUNS DINGS 'A",(DUNS BEATS ALL) ORIGINATES THEN. IN 1881 MOTHER SHIPTON SAID THE WORLD WOULD END SO EVERYONE SAT IN THE SCHOOL & WAITED- NOTHING HAPPENED! THE{HIRING OF FARM WORKERS}TOOK PLACE EVERY MARCH. {POLISH}AIRMEN WERE STATIONED IN DUNS IN THE 1939-45 WAR & SOME ARE STILL HERE.THE {QUEEN}HAS VISITED TWICE.
